subject: YAPC::NA is upon us!

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.author: jt_smith
entries.text: JT introduces his new SVG::Estimate module, which estimates the length of all vectors in an SVG file.
entries.title: Introducing SVG::Estimate

entries.text: Tom describes the changes in the new version of his Perl::Critic::Policy::Variables::ProhibitUnusedVarsStricter module. It's a Perl::Critic policy for catching unused variables.
entries.author: tom_wyant
entries.title: Refactor of Perl Critic policy ProhibitUnusedVarsStricter

entries.text: Thomas has created a simple Plack app for monitoring a server.
entries.author: thomas_klausner
entries.title: Announcing Plack::App::ServiceStatus

entries.author: christian_walde
entries.text: Christian is doing some developer releases of the OpenGL module, and would like your help: please try and install it, and let him know what happens.
entries.title: Please test developer releases of OpenGL
P5P Mailing List Summary: June 9th-15th
entries.text: I didn't have time to read it closely, but possibly something about French onion soup?
entries.author: sawyer_x
jt_smith
entries.text: JT laments the loss of smart match. It's only a short post, but read the comments.
entries.title: Missing Smart Match
Watch regexes with Regexp::Debugger
entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: A short post from brian about Regexp::Debugger, which can animate a regular expression matching string, to help you understand how it works.

entries.title: Three-argument form of open used and it is not available until perl 5.6
entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Hopefully we all know now why we should use the three argument version of open(). But if you do, you really should include use 5.006; in your code.

entries.title: A Perl toolchain for building micro-services at scale
entries.text: Amarnath and Srinivas describe the Perl toolbox that's been used to build micro-services at Semantics3.
entries.author: amarnath_ravikumar

entries.title: YAPC::NA::2016 - Wednesday Night Pull Request Challenge
entries.author: brett_estrade
entries.text: Wednesday night at YAPC there's a mini pull request challenge (yay!), with food and drink sponsored by Craigslist. Why not go along and help someone else's CPAN distribution?

entries.title: perl6: count chinese characters in string
entries.text: A short post showing how you can count the number of characters (in this case Chinese characters) in a string with Perl 6.

entries.author: jonathan_taylor
entries.text: Jonathan argues that the Perl community just isn't very welcoming for beginners, particularly in the exactly the places that are meant to be for beginners.
entries.title: Newbie Poison
Tony Cook's report
entries.text: Tony's ongoing work for his Perl 5 grant.
entries.author: tony_cook

entries.title: Dave Mitchell's report
entries.author: dave_mitchell
entries.text: Dave spent some time trying to make Scope::Upper work under Perl 5.24.

entries.title: 10 tips for new GitHub projects
entries.text: Ten good things to do with a new GitHub repo.

header: Today is the first day of YAPC::NA — hopefully those of you in Orlando will have a great week. The keynotes are going to be live-streamed for those of us who couldn't attend in person, and recordings of all other talks will be available at some point. Go to the YAPC::NA channel on YouTube to look for videos.

This is the 256th issue of Perl Weekly!
I've only been doing this gig for the last 80 issues, so Kudos to Gabor
for starting this and keeping it going.
